FRIDAY Oct PERIOD   HealthDay News  A tentative deal has been reached between Kaiser Permanente and its  health care workers following a threeday strike last week PERIOD

 union officials posted Friday on X formerly known as Twitter PERIOD

 Kaiser Permanente said in an X post PERIOD

Health care workers who serve millions of Americans began the threeday strike after contract negotiations over staffing levels stalled PERIOD The union represents medical assistants surgical and lab technicians and pharmacists among other staffers PERIOD Along with staffing levels pay and benefits are an issue CNBC reported PERIOD

The strike targeted Kaiser hospitals and medical offices in California Colorado Oregon Virginia the District of Columbia and Washington state PERIOD Employees in Kaisers Georgia facilities were not affected PERIOD Kaiser Permanente serves nearly  million patients and operates  hospitals and more than  medical offices across the United States PERIOD

Kaiser generated  billion in revenue in the second quarter of  PERIOD It reported  billion in profit for the quarter up from a loss of . billion during same quarter in  CNBC reported PERIOD

CNBC Article
